Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Class that extends JFrame to represent a tic tac toe board. Initializes a series of disabled buttons that serve as the cross board, and hold methods to mark player inputs on the board, as well as interpret board state to check for a game over and control gameplay. Can be interacted with by any Player class, regardless if Human or Computer extensions.

    Completed as part of the S20_TicTacToe_Hard assignment

    See Also:
    Player, HumanPlayer, ComputerPlayer, JFrame, Board(Player, Player), Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(Player playerOne,
             Player playerTwo)
        A constructor for the board that stores references to the players to validate their input, and place the required GUI elements on screen. After visual layouts are arranged, the board enters a gameplay loop determined by isGameOver()
        Parameters:
        playerOne - a reference to the first player object
        playerTwo - a reference to the second player object
        See Also:
        Player, HumanPlayer, ComputerPlayer

    • Method Detail

      • print

        private void print(java.lang.String message)
        Print a message to the log above the tictactoe board
        Parameters:
        message - message to be displayed

      • mark

        public boolean mark(int slot,
                    char symbol)
        Mark a slot on the board and alter it's text if allowed by game rules. If allowed and mark is made, return true, if not, return false.
        Parameters:
        slot - slot requested to alter
        symbol - symbol to be marked if allowed
        Returns:
        result of successful mark

      • isGameOver

        private boolean isGameOver()
        Check the 10 possible scenarios in which a game of tictactoe could end, detailed in comments within the method.
        Returns:
        if game is over based on board state
